bug.short_desc: MenuButton does not close the popup if clicked

long_desc.thetext:
This issue is reproducable for example at the playground application. If the user clicks at the "Gist" menu button the shown popup is not hidden if the user clicks the second time.
The menu button should hide its popup if the button is clicked again.

The menu manager bubbles up the element hierarchy to check if the clicked widget is the menus opener. For that, it uses a method in qx.ui.core.Wiget named getWidgetByElement which doen't care about the anonymous state. If someone clicks on the icon of the menu button, the returned widget will be the icon which is not the openen of the menu. The consequence is that the menu will be closed and right after that openend again because you just clicked the button to open the menu. Maybe it worked in the older version because we attached the listeners in a different order.
The solution was to introduce a new parameter to the getWidgetByElement method which enables the method to ignore anonymous widgets.
